tn.ref: the tenth day of the fifth month
tn.text: This is the fifth month of the Hebrew calendar. The tenth day is near the beginning of August on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"in front of me"

tn.ref: I will not be inquired of by you
tn.text: AT: "I will not allow you to ask for any message from me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Will you judge them? Will you judge, son of man
tn.text: AT: "You judge them, son of man." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: It was flowing with milk and honey
tn.text: "A land where plenty of milk and honey flowed." AT: "It was very fertile land" or "It was land where animals and plants grew very well." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to the elders of Israel.

tn.text: This phrase means "so the nations would not think that my name was unholy." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"they were living."

tn.text: "I showed the nations who I am"

tn.text: AT: "But I still pitied them." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"and I did not destroy them"
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to the elders of Israel.

tn.ref: Do not walk according to the statutes of your parents
tn.text: "Do not do the things that your parents commanded you to do"
"do not obey their rules"

tn.ref: keep my decrees and obey them!
tn.text: To "keep" Yahweh's decrees is the same as to "obey them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to the elders of Israel.

tn.ref: They did not walk in my statutes
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:20:13|20:13]].

tn.ref: so I determined to pour out my fury upon them to satisfy my wrath
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:20:08|20:8]].
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to the elders of Israel.
It was a common practice to take an oath by raising a hand toward heaven.

tn.ref: scatter them among the nations and disperse them among the lands
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:12:14|12:15]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Their eyes were longing after their fathers' idols
tn.text: AT: "they were eager to worship the idols that their parents had worshiped." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to the elders of Israel.

tn.ref: Then I also gave them statutes that were not good, and decrees by which they could not live
tn.text: The words statutes in this phrase do not refer to God's law. God permitted them to live by human laws and judgments that were not good.
The word "them" refers to the children of those whom Yahweh brought out of Egypt.
AT: "by the gifts that they gave me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This mean to sacrifice children to idols by burning them alive. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: What is this high place where you bring offerings there
tn.text: AT: "This is not a high place where you are to bring offerings!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
AT: "People have called that place Bamah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]]) "Bamah" means "high place," a place for worshiping idols.
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to the house of Israel.

tn.ref: put your sons into the fire
tn.text: This mean to sacrifice children to idols by burning them alive. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: So why should I let you question me ... Israel?
tn.text: AT: "You have no right to ask me for a message ... Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to the house of Israel.

tn.ref: a mighty hand, a raised arm
tn.text: Both of these phrases refer to great power. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to the house of Israel.

"the offerings that you set aside to give to me"

tn.ref: bring you out from the peoples and gather you out of the countries
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize that Yahweh will bring his people back from all of the nations to which he had scattered them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
AT: "I have scattered you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I will show myself as holy among you for the nations to see
tn.text: "I will use you to show the nations that I am holy"
